text:
BRIAN FALLON: So what I
think is happening here

is Donald Trump is trading on
the deputy attorney general's

strong independent reputation
and trying to pretend that that

is the reason why he is imposing
this firing on Jim Comey when

really he's doing it to get
out from under the Russia
investigation.

The only thing that I think
could have further deteriorated

confidence and eroded faith
in the institution of the FBI

than Jim Comey remaining
there was firing Jim Comey.
And now Donald Trump has done--
gone and done that.

The only thing that
can happen now--

we need a special counsel
inside the Justice Department,

because you have-- as
Jeffrey just noted,

you have political appointees
now guiding this investigation

into the president
who appointed them
and to whom they owe their jobs.
That is untenable.

You need a special counsel
inside the Justice Department

who does not owe their
job to Donald Trump
to investigate Donald Trump.

And separately,
outside, you need an
independent select commission.

Congress needs to submit to
an independent commission

with subpoena power
so that we can finally
get to the bottom of this.

Otherwise, I'm afraid that
the firing of Jim Comey

will mean that we'll never get
to the bottom of the Russian--

Well, Well, me ask
you this, Brian--
don't you think the--

now the acting FBI director,
the deputy director of the FBI,

can continue this criminal
investigation that was launched

back in July into allegations
of collusion between Trump
associates and Russia?

Can't that investigation
continue now?

BRIAN FALLON: It might
be able to nominally,
but not with any credibility.
